alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 7:25PM CST until February 02 at 9:36AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Denham Springs affecting Livingston and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Denham Springs, Bayou Manchac Point...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River At Denham Springs. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Flooding will begin in the westernmost parts of Denham Springs. River Road at the foot of Benton Lane will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 29.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.6 feet on 03/04/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
